content:
Since the acquisition of the Star Wars and Marvel franchises, Disney has made several significant changes to its content. Here are some of the most notable ones:

1. Expansion of the Star Wars Universe: Disney has developed an extensive Star Wars Universe, consisting of movies, TV shows, books, comics, and games. Some of the most iconic Star Wars films to come out under Disney's ownership include "The Force Awakens," "Rogue One," and "The Last Jedi." Disney has also produced several animated TV shows, including "Star Wars: The Clone Wars" and "Star Wars Rebels," which provide more depth to the Star Wars Universe.

2. Introduction of Marvel Cinematic Universe: Disney's acquisition of Marvel has resulted in the creation of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU), which has become one of the most successful movie franchises in history. The MCU consists of over 20 movies, including "Iron Man," "The Avengers," "Black Panther," and "Captain Marvel."

3. Increased Diversity: Disney has made strides towards diversifying its content since the addition of the Star Wars and Marvel franchises. With the introduction of characters like Rey, Finn, Black Panther, and Captain Marvel, Disney is representing more diverse voices and perspectives in its properties.

4. More Villains: One change that fans have noted since the acquisition of the Star Wars and Marvel franchises is the increased focus on villains. Disney has created some of the most terrifying villains in recent memory, including Darth Vader, Kylo Ren, Thanos, and Killmonger.

5. Franchise Cross-Overs: Disney has also explored cross-overs between its franchises. In "Avengers: Infinity War," the Avengers fought alongside the Guardians of the Galaxy, while "Star Wars Rebels" brought in characters from "The Clone Wars." These cross-overs have pleased fans and generated excitement for future collaborations.
